text:
During a visit to the Hyde Park Academy in the city, several teenage girls were drawn to Prince Harry with one asking him to eat Chicago’s famous style of pizza. She said: “When Prince Harry’s here, he eats Chicago — make sure he has a pizza.” To which the royal revealed his shocking dietary revelation. He replied: “I had pizza last night. I don’t even eat pizza anymore, but I had pizza last night.

GETTY Prince Harry has revealed another secret about his dietary habits on a visit to Chicago

“We had deep dish, and we had thin crust. “I promise you, I will make sure I eat Chicago.” As well as discussing his dietary details with the people of Chicago, the prince also stated his belief that young people hold "the solutions to some of the world's biggest problems" at the inaugural Obama Foundation Summit. The Prince, who attended the event a year on from when news of his relationship with actress Meghan Markle hit the headlines, said the younger generation had "turned me into an optimist", as he talked about meeting young people across the world.

Prince Harry in pictures Sun, October 1, 2017 Prince Harry on his royal visits around the world in pictures. Play slideshow PA 1 of 367 Prince Harry shares his pop corn with Emily Henson, daughter of Hayley Henson as he attends the Sitting Volleyball Finals

He said they gave him "all of my passion and inspiration", adding: "The younger generation are the best connected, the most passionate I think we've ever had. "So what we need to do is we need to create a platform so they can be heard, because they have the solutions to the some of the world's biggest problems." The 33-year-old spoke openly about how his late mother had inspired him to use his role to help others, and talked of the work of the Royal Foundation, which he set up alongside his brother Prince William in 2009. Earlier in the day, Prince Harry and Michelle Obama had surprised pupils at Hyde Park Academy high school, in the south of Chicago where he was questioned about the city’s unique pizza.
